trans-unit.source: REST API Reference
trans-unit.target: REST API Reference

trans-unit.source: Azure API Management REST API Reference
trans-unit.target: Azure API Management REST API Reference

trans-unit.source: <token>azure_apimgt_2</token> provides a REST API for performing operations on selected entities, such as users, groups, products, and subscriptions.
trans-unit.target: <token>azure_apimgt_2</token> provides a REST API for performing operations on selected entities, such as users, groups, products, and subscriptions.

trans-unit.source: This reference provides a guide for working with the <token>azure_apimgt_3</token> REST API, as well as specific reference information for each available operation, grouped by entity.
trans-unit.target: This reference provides a guide for working with the <token>azure_apimgt_3</token> REST API, as well as specific reference information for each available operation, grouped by entity.

trans-unit.source: <token>crabout</token> working with the REST API, see the <externalLink><linkText>API Management .NET REST API Sample</linkText><linkUri>https://github.com/Azure/api-management-samples/tree/master/restApiDemo</linkUri></externalLink> and the <externalLink><linkText>Getting Started with Azure API Management REST API</linkText><linkUri>http://azure.microsoft.com/documentation/videos/getting-started-with-azure-api-management-rest-api/</linkUri></externalLink> video.
trans-unit.target: <token>crabout</token> working with the REST API, see the <externalLink><linkText>API Management .NET REST API Sample</linkText><linkUri>https://github.com/Azure/api-management-samples/tree/master/restApiDemo</linkUri></externalLink> and the <externalLink><linkText>Getting Started with Azure API Management REST API</linkText><linkUri>http://azure.microsoft.com/documentation/videos/getting-started-with-azure-api-management-rest-api/</linkUri></externalLink> video.

trans-unit.source: In this topic
trans-unit.target: In this topic

trans-unit.source: Prerequisites
trans-unit.target: Prerequisites

trans-unit.source: To successfully make calls to the <token>azure_apimgt_3</token> REST API, the following prerequisites must be met.
trans-unit.target: To successfully make calls to the <token>azure_apimgt_3</token> REST API, the following prerequisites must be met.

trans-unit.source: Enable access to the REST API
trans-unit.target: Enable access to the REST API

trans-unit.source: Access to the API Management REST API must be granted before calls can be successfully made.
trans-unit.target: Access to the API Management REST API must be granted before calls can be successfully made.

trans-unit.source: To enable access, sign into the <externalLink><linkText>Azure Management Portal</linkText><linkUri>https://manage.windowsazure.com/</linkUri></externalLink>, navigate to your <token>azure_apimgt_3</token> service instance, and click <ui>Manage</ui> to open the publisher portal.
trans-unit.target: To enable access, sign into the <externalLink><linkText>Azure Management Portal</linkText><linkUri>https://manage.windowsazure.com/</linkUri></externalLink>, navigate to your <token>azure_apimgt_3</token> service instance, and click <ui>Manage</ui> to open the publisher portal.

trans-unit.source: Click <ui>Security</ui> in the <ui>API Management</ui> section of the left navigation menu, select the <ui>API Management REST API</ui> tab, and ensure that the <ui>Enable API Management REST API</ui> checkbox is checked.
trans-unit.target: Click <ui>Security</ui> in the <ui>API Management</ui> section of the left navigation menu, select the <ui>API Management REST API</ui> tab, and ensure that the <ui>Enable API Management REST API</ui> checkbox is checked.

trans-unit.source: If the <ui>Enable API Management REST API</ui> checkbox is not checked, calls made to the REST API for that service instance will fail.
trans-unit.target: If the <ui>Enable API Management REST API</ui> checkbox is not checked, calls made to the REST API for that service instance will fail.

trans-unit.source: Default media type
trans-unit.target: Default media type

trans-unit.source: The default media type for requests and responses is <codeInline>application/json</codeInline>.
trans-unit.target: The default media type for requests and responses is <codeInline>application/json</codeInline>.

trans-unit.source: Where noted, some operations support other content types.
trans-unit.target: Where noted, some operations support other content types.

trans-unit.source: If no additional content type is mentioned for a specific operation, then the media type is <codeInline>application/json</codeInline>.
trans-unit.target: If no additional content type is mentioned for a specific operation, then the media type is <codeInline>application/json</codeInline>.

trans-unit.source: Authentication
trans-unit.target: Authentication

trans-unit.source: Each request to the <token>azure_apimgt_3</token> REST API must be accompanied by an <codeInline>Authorization</codeInline> header containing a valid shared access token, as shown in the following example.
trans-unit.target: Each request to the <token>azure_apimgt_3</token> REST API must be accompanied by an <codeInline>Authorization</codeInline> header containing a valid shared access token, as shown in the following example.

trans-unit.source: This access token can be generated programmatically or from within the API Management publisher portal.
trans-unit.target: This access token can be generated programmatically or from within the API Management publisher portal.

trans-unit.source: For instructions on generating and retrieving the access token, see <link xlink:href="5b13010a-d202-4af5-aabf-7ebc26800b3d#ManuallyCreateToken" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">To manually create an access token</link> and <link xlink:href="5b13010a-d202-4af5-aabf-7ebc26800b3d#ProgrammaticallyCreateToken" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">To programmatically create an access token</link>.
trans-unit.target: For instructions on generating and retrieving the access token, see <link xlink:href="5b13010a-d202-4af5-aabf-7ebc26800b3d#ManuallyCreateToken" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">To manually create an access token</link> and <link xlink:href="5b13010a-d202-4af5-aabf-7ebc26800b3d#ProgrammaticallyCreateToken" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">To programmatically create an access token</link>.

trans-unit.source: Base URL
trans-unit.target: Base URL

trans-unit.source: The Base URL of the <token>azure_apimgt_3</token> REST API conforms to the following template.
trans-unit.target: The Base URL of the <token>azure_apimgt_3</token> REST API conforms to the following template.

trans-unit.source: This template contains the following parameter.
trans-unit.target: This template contains the following parameter.

trans-unit.source: <codeInline>{serviceName}</codeInline> is the service name as it was specified during service creation, for example <codeInline>https://contosoapi.management.azure-api.net</codeInline>.
trans-unit.target: <codeInline>{serviceName}</codeInline> is the service name as it was specified during service creation, for example <codeInline>https://contosoapi.management.azure-api.net</codeInline>.

trans-unit.source: All URLs returned by the <token>azure_apimgt_3</token> REST API are relative to this base URL, and all requests to the REST API must use this base URL template.
trans-unit.target: All URLs returned by the <token>azure_apimgt_3</token> REST API are relative to this base URL, and all requests to the REST API must use this base URL template.

trans-unit.source: Version Query Parameter
trans-unit.target: Version Query Parameter

trans-unit.source: All operations expect an <codeInline>api-version</codeInline> query parameter with a value in the format of <codeInline>YYYY-MM-DD</codeInline>, for example <codeInline>2014-02-14</codeInline>.
trans-unit.target: All operations expect an <codeInline>api-version</codeInline> query parameter with a value in the format of <codeInline>YYYY-MM-DD</codeInline>, for example <codeInline>2014-02-14</codeInline>.

trans-unit.source: During the preview period for API Management, <codeInline>-preview</codeInline> is appended to the version query parameter, for example <codeInline>2014-02-14-preview</codeInline>.
trans-unit.target: During the preview period for API Management, <codeInline>-preview</codeInline> is appended to the version query parameter, for example <codeInline>2014-02-14-preview</codeInline>.

trans-unit.source: If this query parameter is not passed in the query string of a request, the server will return a status code of <codeInline>400 Bad Request</codeInline>.
trans-unit.target: If this query parameter is not passed in the query string of a request, the server will return a status code of <codeInline>400 Bad Request</codeInline>.

trans-unit.source: For a list of supported versions, see the following <link xlink:href="1b96aa01-6b6a-4d20-b8f3-ccd1d668b2f9#VersionHistory" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">API Management REST API version history</link> section.
trans-unit.target: For a list of supported versions, see the following <link xlink:href="1b96aa01-6b6a-4d20-b8f3-ccd1d668b2f9#VersionHistory" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">API Management REST API version history</link> section.

trans-unit.source: API Management REST API version history
trans-unit.target: API Management REST API version history

trans-unit.source: The following table shows the API Management REST API versions, and the major modifications that were made to each version.
trans-unit.target: The following table shows the API Management REST API versions, and the major modifications that were made to each version.

trans-unit.source: Each version is identified by a date, which is used as the value for the <link xlink:href="1b96aa01-6b6a-4d20-b8f3-ccd1d668b2f9#VersionQueryParameter" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Version Query Parameter</link> when making an HTTP request.
trans-unit.target: Each version is identified by a date, which is used as the value for the <link xlink:href="1b96aa01-6b6a-4d20-b8f3-ccd1d668b2f9#VersionQueryParameter" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Version Query Parameter</link> when making an HTTP request.
